intro: Quercus tepicana, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a rounded crown and thick, fissured bark. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and lobed, often with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
